sentences: Sa valetad tavaliselt kui teed midagi halba.
Me ei usu et sa valetad meid.
translation: they don't believe you are lying to them
context: The word 'valetad' is the 2nd person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'valema', which means 'to lie'. It specifically refers to when someone (the person being addressed) tells a falsehood or makes an untrue statement. This is commonly used in everyday situations when addressing someone directly about their dishonest behavior.
